page.title: 03Hedgerows on Lound Farms
page.content: Hedgerows are usually used to separate farms and fields in the Lound area. The farmers questioned felt that they were the best method. Hedges are hawthorn and blackthorn. A good hedge is about 1.5m wide and high,with few trees as roots take moisture from the land and cast shadows. The disadvantages of hedges are keeping them in good condition,controlling the hedges' wild -life which harms crops,and the amount of land they take. Mr. Hill,a dairy farmer,reckons hedges are ideal on his farm. They stop stock roaming,act as a windbreak for his stock and crops, and protect his fields against soil erosion. He has kept hedgerows because small fields of 7-9 acres are suited to his farm. Arable farms require fields of at least 15 acres so that modern machinery can manoeuvre,so farmers have felt it necessary to remove hedges.
